text: Assertion: When bodies are charged through friction, there is a transfer of electric charge from one body to another, but no creation or destruction of charge. Reason: This follows from conservation of electric charges.

options.a: If both assertion and reason are true and reason is the correct explanation of assertion
options.b: If both assertion and reason are true but reason is not the correct explanation of assertion
options.c: If assertion is true but reason is false
options.d: If both assertion and reason are false

hint: Conservation of electric charges states that the total charge of an isolated system remains unchanged with time.
